verses.verse: (For the choir director; with stringed instruments, upon an eight-stringed lyre.) (A Psalm of David.) O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> do not rebuke <S%H3198><s%> me in Thine anger, <S%H639><s%> Nor <S%H408><s%> chasten <S%H3256><s%> me in Thy wrath. <S%H2534><s%>

Be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to me, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> for I [am] pining <S%H536><s%> away; <S%H536><s%> Heal <S%H7495><s%> me, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> for my bones <S%H6106><s%> are dismayed. <S%H926><s%>
And my soul <S%H5315><s%> is greatly <S%H3966><s%> dismayed; <S%H926><s%> But Thou, O Lord <S%H3068><s%> â€“ how <S%H4970><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4970><s%>?
Return, <S%H7725><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> rescue <S%H2502><s%> my soul; <S%H5315><s%> Save <S%H3467><s%> me because <S%H4616><s%> of Thy lovingkindness. <S%H2617><s%>
For there <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> mention <S%H2143><s%> of Thee in death; <S%H4194><s%> In Sheol <S%H7585><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> will give <S%H3034><s%> Thee thanks <S%H3034><s%>?

I am weary <S%H3021><s%> with my sighing; <S%H585><s%> Every <S%H3605><s%> night <S%H3915><s%> I make my bed <S%H4296><s%> swim, <S%H7811><s%> I dissolve <S%H4529><s%> my couch <S%H6210><s%> with my tears. <S%H1832><s%>
My eye <S%H5869><s%> has wasted <S%H6244><s%> away <S%H6244><s%> with grief; <S%H3708><s%> It has become <S%H6275><s%> old <S%H6275><s%> because of all <S%H3605><s%> my adversaries. <S%H6887><s%>
Depart <S%H5493><s%> from me, all <S%H3605><s%> you who do <S%H6466><s%> iniquity, <S%H205><s%> For the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my weeping. <S%H1065><s%>
The Lord <S%H3068><s%> has heard <S%H8085><s%> my supplication, <S%H8467><s%> The Lord <S%H3068><s%> receives <S%H3947><s%> my prayer. <S%H8605><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> my enemies <S%H340><s%> shall be ashamed <S%H954><s%> and greatly <S%H3966><s%> dismayed; <S%H926><s%> They shall turn <S%H7725><s%> back, <S%H7725><s%> they shall suddenly <S%H7281><s%> be ashamed. <S%H954><s%>
